remarks: Two (nonempty) words are equal if and only if they have the same prefix and the same single symbol suffix.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 23-Sep-2018.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro/AV, 23-Oct-2018.)
statement: 2swrd1eqwrdeq $p |- ( ( W e. Word V /\ U e. Word V /\ 0 < ( # ` W ) ) -> ( W = U <-> ( ( # ` W ) = ( # ` U ) /\ ( ( W substr <. 0 , ( ( # ` W ) - 1 ) >. ) = ( U substr <. 0 , ( ( # ` W ) - 1 ) >. ) /\ ( lastS ` W ) = ( lastS ` U ) ) ) ) ) $.
